newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL palm oil ends marginally down in slow deal.
newsitem.headline: KL palm oil ends marginally down in slow deal.

text.p: PALM OIL FUTURES PALM OIL PHYSICAL

PALM OIL FUTURES - Prices ended slightly lower after drifting within narrow ranges. The March 1-25 export data from SGS has no impact on the market which lacked participation. June futures contract was seen trading narrowly, with resistance at 1,250 and support at 1,225.
PALM OIL PHYSICAL - Lack of demand also saw selective dealing among crude palm oil and selected oils.
"The market was seen consolidating for the greater part of the day," a trader said, adding that players were reluctant to take up huge positions while waiting for more leads.

Physical Mar (south) crude palm oil was offered at 1,280 ringgit and bids of 1,277.50 after trading at 1,277.50 and 1,280. Mar (central) saw offers at 1,260 against bids of 1,255 and Mar (north) at 1,245 against 1,240.
Apr (south) was offered at 1,280 with bids at 1,277.50 with early transactions at 1,277.50 and 1,280, and Apr (central) at 1,260 against 1,255.
Among refined products, Apr RBD palm oil was offered at $540 a tonne FOB Malaysia, May at $535, June at $532.50 and July/Aug/Sep at $527.50.
Apr RBD palm olein saw offers at $575, May at $567.50, Jun at $565 and July/Aug/Sep at 560. Apr was traded at $575 and $572.50, and May at $567.50.
Apr RBD palm stearin was offered at $435 and Apr/May palm fatty acid distillate saw sellers at $300.
